docs.lead_paragraph: THERE was a flurry of anxiety in official circles three years ago when Pfizer Inc. closed some of its operations in the East Williamsburg section of Brooklyn. Did this foreshadow a departure from the city of Brooklyn's largest manufacturing employer, with a loss of 750 jobs? No, said the company at the time. And now Pfizer is participating with the city, through the Public Development Corporation, in a joint industrial, commercial and residential redevelopment program in the vicinity of its plant, a move likely to reinforce its presence for years to come. Nothing like it has been tried before by a manufacturer in the city.

headline.main: PFIZER TO ANCHOR A REDEVELOPMENT ZONE
